JUnit5TestShouldBePackagePrivate.description:
Description

Reports JUnit 5 test classes and methods that are not package-private.
Contrary to JUnit 4 tests, which required public visibility to be run by the engine,
JUnit 5 tests can also be run if theyâ€™re package-private. Marking them as such
is a good practice to limit their visibility.

Test methods are identified as those which use@Test,@RepeatedTest,@TestFactory,@TestTemplateor@ParameterizedTest.

Example(s):

Use this rule by referencing it:
JUnit5TestShouldBePackagePrivate.option: This rule has no specific options.
